div.div: Network failure causes distributed systems to become partitioned. Peers are unable to sync between each other

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 110px; margin-left: 101px;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Comic Sans MS"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: color: rgb(0 , 0 , 0) ; font-family: "comic sans ms" ; font-size: 12px ; font-style: normal ; font-weight: 400 ; letter-spacing: normal ; text-align: center ; text-indent: 0px ; text-transform: none ; word-spacing: 0px ; background-color: rgb(248 , 249 , 250) ; display: inline ; float: none

div.span: I've lost peer1. My data could get out of sync. What should I do if I get a request now. Should I refuse to service it and throw an error (impacts availability) or should I service it with potentially stale data (impacts consistency)

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
